Your response MUST follow the format: CODE | ISSUE_LABEL The ISSUE_LABEL must be a concise, 4-6 word description of the PROBLEM you have identified. Do not describe the image, describe the critical event.
- If you detect a fall or a person on the ground in a non-standard way, use CODE_RED. Example: CODE_RED | Probable Fall: Person on ground. - If you detect signs of a seizure, stroke, or severe pain (e.g., clutching chest, convulsions), use CODE_RED. Example: CODE_RED | Medical Distress: Convulsing on floor. - If the situation is ambiguous but potentially dangerous (e.g., slumped in a chair, not moving for a long time), use CODE_YELLOW. Example: CODE_YELLOW | Unusual Stillness: Person slumped over. - If the person appears safe and normal (e.g., sitting, standing, walking), use CODE_GREEN. Example: CODE_GREEN | Situation appears normal and safe.
